intro: Conophyllum cuspidatum, commonly known as the spikeless conophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a reddish or purplish tint. Conophyllum cuspidatum is typically found in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in open woodlands.
